Examples

Source code

Source code for all examples can be found here

2D

cargo run --example 2d --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how to create 2D scene.

2D Scene

cargo run --example 2d_scene --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how to load 2D scene made in the FyroxEd.

3rd Person

cargo run --example 3rd_person --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

This is the most complex example in the engine, it show how to load a game level, create character with animations and basic controls.

Async Scene Loading

cargo run --example async --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example show how to load (or create) game scenes asynchronously, it is very useful if your game have a lot of assets and you don't to 'hang' your game while assets are loading.

Button

cargo run --example button --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how to create simple button and handle its events. The button will jump to new position every time its clicked.

Compressed Textures

cargo run --example compressed_textures --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how to use texture compression options to reduce GPU memory consumption and to speed up rendering.

Custom Loop

cargo run --example custom_loop --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how to create custom game loop. It might be useful if you need deep control over update calls. It can only be used if the engine is used as a Framework.

Framework

cargo run --example framework --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how to use the engine as a Framework - a minimal working environment without ability to run your games in the editor.

Grid

cargo run --example grid --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how to use Grid widget to arrange UI elements in a grid.

Instancing

cargo run --example instancing --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how the engine handles multiple instances of the same 3D model.

Light Map

cargo run --example lightmap --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how to generate (or use generated) light map. Light map is a ''baked' lighting, that has almost no performance impact.

Level of Detail

cargo run --example lod --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how to use level-of-detail technique to optimize rendering for distance objects.

Custom Material

cargo run --example material --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how to create custom shader and material and use it for rendering.

Navigational Meshes

cargo run --example navmesh --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how to use navigational meshes and navigation agents for path finding.

Save/Load

cargo run --example save_load --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how to use built-in serializer to create saved games and load them.

Save/Load

cargo run --example scene --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how to load a scene made in FyroxEd.

Simple Procedural Scene

cargo run --example simple --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how to create a simple procedural scene directly, without using FyroxEd.

Sound

cargo run --example sound --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how create sound sources and sound effects.

Procedural Terrain

cargo run --example terrain --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how create procedural terrain.

User Interface

cargo run --example ui --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

The example shows how create user interface and handle its events to perform some actions.

Scripting

cd examples/scripting && cargo run --package [editor/executor] --release
Code has been copied to clipboard

Scripting example shows how to create game plugin with custom scripts. It is possible to run it in two 'modes' - editor or executor.

Fyrox Engine 2022
